unnormalised: **Entertainment: Bollywood Releases - Buckle Up, Butter Chicken is On Hold!**
normalised: **Entertainment: Bollywood Releases - Buckle Up, Butter Chicken is On Hold!**

unnormalised: Mumbai: Forget your weekend plans, folks! Bollywood is unleashing a tidal wave of films this week, threatening to swamp your local cinema hall faster than you can say "dialogue-baazi."
normalised: Mumbai: Forget your weekend plans, folks! Bollywood is unleashing a tidal wave of films this week, threatening to swamp your local cinema hall faster than you can say "dialogue-baazi."

unnormalised: First up, "Prem ki Pariksha," starring the ever-youthful Rajpal Yadav (yes, still playing a college student). Critics are already predicting it's either a cinematic masterpiece or the perfect cure for insomnia. We're leaning towards the latter, honestly.
normalised: First up, "Prem ki Pariksha," starring the ever-youthful Rajpal Yadav (yes, still playing a college student). Critics are already predicting it's either a cinematic masterpiece or the perfect cure for insomnia. We're leaning towards the latter, honestly.

unnormalised: Then there's "Dangal 2.0: Electric Boogaloo," which *apparently* has nothing to do with wrestling but *everything* to do with genetically modified mangoes. Don't ask. We don’t understand either.
normalised: Then there's "Dangal two point zero: Electric Boogaloo," which *apparently* has nothing to do with wrestling but *everything* to do with genetically modified mangoes. Don't ask. We don’t understand either.

unnormalised: And finally, the big one: "Biryani Blues," a musical drama set against the backdrop of an Onam celebration in Kerala. Rumour has it, the dance numbers feature actual biryani being thrown, leading to some seriously messy outtakes. Expect at least 3 item songs and a climax involving a runaway elephant.
normalised: And finally, the big one: "Biryani Blues," a musical drama set against the backdrop of an Onam celebration in Kerala. Rumour has it, the dance numbers feature actual biryani being thrown, leading to some seriously messy outtakes. Expect at least three item songs and a climax involving a runaway elephant.

unnormalised: So, ditch the Netflix, grab your popcorn (or your own biryani, we won’t judge) and prepare for a rollercoaster ride of questionable plots, over-the-top acting, and songs that will haunt your dreams. This week, Bollywood's taking no prisoners! Estimated box office collection: Rs. 500 crore (or thereabouts...maybe).
